ETYMOLOGY: From French secrétariat, from secrétaire 'secretary', from Medieval Latin sēcrētārius 'clerk, notary'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The administrative office or staff of a large organization, an international body, or a government department.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 大型组织、国际机构或政府部门的行政办公室或工作人员。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The UN Secretariat is responsible for implementing the decisions of the UN's main bodies.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 联合国秘书处负责执行联合国主要机构的决定。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The office or position held by a secretary or a secretary-general.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 秘书或秘书长所担任的职务或职位。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He served in the secretariat of the Commonwealth for many years.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他曾在英联邦秘书处任职多年。

REGISTER: Formal and official contexts, especially in international relations, government, and large organizational structures.
